problem_text:
Is it true that every residually finite group in which every subgroup of finite index (including the group itself) is defined by a single defining relation is either free or isomorphic to the fundamental group of a compact surface?
O. V. Mel’nikov
answer: No; for example, let Hn = ⟨x, y | y−1xy = xn⟩, n = 2, 3, . . . ; then every subgroup of finite index in Hn is isomorphic to a group Hm for some m (V. A. Churkin, Abstracts of 8th All-USSR Symp. on Group Theory, Kiev, 1982, 139–140 (Russian)).
